SEARCH
Package com.project.saintcyshospital.ws

Class ChatWsHub

java.lang.Object
com.project.saintcyshospital.ws.ChatWsHub
public class ChatWsHub extends Object
Room-scoped chat websocket hub.

Connects to /chat, sends a CHAT_JOIN for the active room, relays incoming messages as local broadcasts (action ACTION_CHAT_MESSAGE) that include EXTRA_CONVO_ID, EXTRA_SENDER, and EXTRA_CONTENT.

Use start(Context, String) in ChatDetailActivity.onStart() and stop() in onStop().

Author:
Trice Buchanan

    Intent extra key containing the message body/content of the chat notification.
    static final String
    EXTRA_CONVO_ID
    Intent extra key containing the conversation / room identifier associated with a chat message.
    static final String
    EXTRA_SENDER
    Intent extra key containing the logical sender of the message (e.g., "self", "peer", or a user identifier).
    private static final ChatWsHub
    INSTANCE
    Singleton instance of the room-scoped chat websocket hub.

  • Field Details

    • ACTION_CHAT_MESSAGE

      public static final String ACTION_CHAT_MESSAGE
      Local broadcast action for incoming chat messages delivered by the chat websocket. Receivers can extract details using the EXTRA_* keys defined in this class.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

      Singleton instance of the room-scoped chat websocket hub.

    • client

      Underlying websocket client used to connect to the chat endpoint and send/receive frames.

    • appCtx

      private android.content.Context appCtx
      Application context captured from the first start(Context, String) call. Used for broadcasting messages without leaking activity contexts.

    • activeConversationId

      private String activeConversationId
      Currently joined conversation / room id. Used both when sending the initial JOIN frame and when broadcasting incoming messages.

  • Method Details

    • get

      public static ChatWsHub get()
      Returns the shared ChatWsHub instance.
      Returns:
      the process-wide chat websocket hub

    • start

      public void start(android.content.Context ctx, String conversationId)
      Starts (or restarts) the chat websocket for the given conversation id and immediately sends a CHAT_JOIN frame.
      Parameters:
      ctx - context used to obtain the application context
      conversationId - the backend room id (e.g., "alice-bob")

    • stop

      public void stop()
      Stops the chat websocket and clears the active room. Safe to call multiple times.

    • connect

      private void connect()
      Internal connect routine: builds the client listener, handles onOpen (JOIN), parses incoming frames, and broadcasts them to the UI layer.

    • send

      public boolean send(String textJson)
      Sends a preformatted JSON string over the active chat websocket.
      Parameters:
      textJson - a JSON payload (e.g., {"type":"CHAT_SEND","roomId":"...","content":"..."})
      Returns:
      true if the client accepted the send, false otherwise
